Dear Maria Elaina Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/17 Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A on the bed and
scratched his left arm and his left eye and he could not see. He
also stated he had a bruise on his left shoulder.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/19/2024 and again via video conference on 9/17/24. She
reported being aware of the incident regarding the allegations.
She reported the staff involved in the allegations has a great
reputation as staff. She reported Staff 1 was written up for holding
the door shut because it was an inappropriate action which should
not have been done. She reported Staff 1 took responsibility for
her actions and was suspended for a time. Administrator reported
Staff 1 was triggered by the attack from Youth A since she was
attacked by other youth in the past. Currently, Staff 1 is on a
safety plan.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/19/2024. Youth A reported another youth was calling him names
from across the hallway and Staff 1 would not let Youth A out of
his room to get the other youth. Youth A reported being grabbed
by Youth A’s arm when he tried to get out of the room. Staff 1
pushed Youth A back into Youth A’s room before slamming the
bedroom door. Youth A reported no one saw this happen because
the youth across the hall who had been yelling at Youth A had
gone to sleep and there were no cameras in Youth A’s room.
Youth A reported anger took over and Youth A attempted to ram
into Staff 1 before being grabbed by Staff 1. Later in the day,
Youth A reported finding a bruise on his arm and the hospital took
pictures of the bruise. Youth A reported Staff 1 scratched his eye
and arm when pushing Youth A on the bed.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/26/2024. She
reported supervising Staff 1 and having no issues with Staff 1.
She reported this is the first-time hearing about any issues with
2

Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported working the day of the incident
and having time to speak with Youth A in the playground area
outside of the facility. She reported checking Youth A and not
noticing any bruising or scratch marks on Youth A as Youth A
described. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A told her Youth A felt bad
for hitting Staff 1 in the stomach and that Staff 1 really “didn’t do
the things” in the allegation.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/26/2024. Staff 1
reported the allegations did not occur and she denied pushing
Youth A on the bed or scratching Youth A’s eye. She reported
Youth A was upset because she informed Youth A that he could
not go downstairs at this time and should sit down on his bed and
work at being calm. Youth A became upset, and Staff 1 reported
shutting the bedroom door because Youth A was going to throw a
cup at her. After hearing the cup hit the door, Staff 1 opened the
door and noticed Youth A was about to throw a DVD player at her
so Staff 1 shut the bedroom door again. Staff 1 reported opening
the door again and asking Youth A if Youth A was done at which
time Youth A punched Staff 1 in the stomach. Staff 1 then shut the
bedroom door and sat down in the chair in the hallway. A few
moments later Youth A came out and apologized for hitting Staff 1
and throwing the cup.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 8/30/2024. Staff 2
reported walking through the large playroom and observing Youth
A hitting himself on the right forearm several times. She believed
Youth A was engaging in self-harm and reported to Supervisor 2.
Staff 2 was still in the playroom when Staff 1 came into the room
and Youth A told Staff 1 to look at what she had caused on his
right forearm. Staff 1 kept walking out of the room because Staff 1
had been informed of the allegations and was to have no contact
with Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A appeared to be “taunting”
Staff 1 in the manner Youth A spoke to Staff 1. Staff 2 described
Youth A as “not a nice kid” because he bullies and tries to
intimidate other youth. She reported Youth A gets upset when not
getting his way and will take his frustration out on staff and other
youth. Staff 2 reported staff will intervene and redirect Youth A
while getting the other youth out of the area to give Youth A
space. Staff 2 reported the facility does not engage in restraints,
so they work at deescalating youth or calling the police if the
violence is too great. She reported an incident in which Youth A hit
her in the chest and after the police spoke with Youth A, Youth A
apologized to Staff 2.
3

Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 8/30/2024.
Supervisor 2 reported writing up an incident report after being
informed of the incident by Staff 2 when Youth A was hitting his
right forearm. He reported being present when Youth A told Staff 1
to look at what she did to his arm. Supervisor 2 observed a red
mark on his right forearm.
Video review:
The camera view is from the end of the hallway with Youth A’s
bedroom on the left. The first time Youth A is observed, Youth A
runs across the hall and into the bedroom across the hall. Staff 1
comes down the hall towards Youth A’s bedroom and Youth A
comes out of the room across the hall and enters Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 1 follows Youth A into Youth A’s bedroom and
appears to push Youth A as evidenced by the pushing motion of
her arms towards Youth A. A few moments later Staff 1 comes
part way out of the room, takes off her lanyard and throws it down
the hall towards the camera. She then shuts the door to the
bedroom and sits down. Approximately 12 minutes later, Youth A
opens the door and stands in the doorway with an object in Youth
A’s hand. Staff 1 is still sitting in a chair in the hallway and when
Youth A comes out of the room, Staff 1 stands up. Youth A goes
back into the bedroom followed by Staff 1. Staff 1 backs out of the
room and holds the door shut. Approximately 4 minutes later Staff
1 opens the door and Youth A comes out of the room and both
leave the hallway going downstairs.
Documents Reviewed:
De-Escalation form/Calming form dated 8/2024 for Youth A.
This document outlines the presenting behaviors, triggers/trauma
history, warning signs, and intervention strategies for Youth A.
Staff are to identify early signs of anger or dysregulation through
careful observation and aim at establishing a detailed
understanding of Youth A’s behavioral patterns. Interventions are
identified as playing outside, video games, watching videos as
methods to help Youth A calm down. Fresh air, movement, and
exercise are also listed.
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy
dated 1/26/2022. This document outlines staff’s response when a
youth becomes dysregulated, and an intervention is needed. Staff
are to have knowledge of each youth’s de-escalation form that
provides a youth’s diagnosis, trauma history, triggers, and
interventions. When engaged in the intervention, staff are to utilize
the CPI supportive stance by maintaining an appropriate distance
4

from the youth. It is also documented that staff are to exit a room
quickly if the youth is attempting to attack or throw things at the
staff. Throughout the process, staff are to encourage the youth to
release energy and try to calm down. Prohibited procedures are
identified and seclusion is listed as is documented as “means the
involuntary placement of a youth in a room alone, where youth is
prevented from exiting by any means”. This also includes staff
members preventing the youth from exiting the room.
Christ Child House Incident Report dated 8/17/2024 at 11:00
am. This document outlines the incident that is described in the
allegations and took place on 8/17/2024 and was written by Staff
1. It is documented that Youth A wanted to go downstairs after
watching a movie. Staff 1 informed Youth A that there was no one
downstairs and Youth A would have to wait to which Youth A
began to become dysregulated. Staff 1 is documented as asking
Youth A to sit on his bed and try to calm down. Youth A became
more upset and tried to throw a cup at Staff 1 who stepped out of
the room shutting the door behind her. After hearing the cup hit
the door, Staff 1 opened the door and Youth A started to throw a
DVD player at Staff 1. When done throwing the DVD player, Staff
1 opened the door again only to be punched in the stomach by
Youth A. Staff 1 shut the door again and sat down in a chair in the
hallway. She stayed there until Youth A came out of his room and
apologized to Staff 1 for hitting and throwing things at her. Staff 1
is documented as telling Youth A she was ok, but that Youth A
needs to learn to control his temper.
Christ Child House Incident Report dated 8/17/2024 at 11:30
am. This document outlines what occurred following the incident
that is described in the allegations and took place on 8/17/2024
and was written by Supervisor 1. It is documented that Youth A
informed Supervisor 1 that Staff 1 threw Youth A on the bed
scratching Youth A’s left wrist, left eye, and bruising Youth A’s left
shoulder. Supervisor 1 examined Youth A and found no such
marks on Youth A. Supervisor 1 followed Youth A outside where
Youth A informed Supervisor that Youth A had hit Staff 1 in the
stomach and was now sorry for hitting her. Youth A was asked if
Staff 1 hurt Youth A and Youth A replied “no”.
Christ Child House Incident Report dated 8/17/2024 at 1:30
pm. This document outlines the incident that is described by Staff
2 and Supervisor 1 and took place on 8/17/2024 and was written
by Supervisor 1 and witnessed by Staff 2. Staff 2 informed
Supervisor 1 that she observed Youth A sitting in the big playroom
punching himself in the forearm and creating a bruise. It is
5

documented that Staff 1 entered the room and Youth A told her
this bruise was caused by Staff 1. Youth A was then taken to
urgent care for an assessment.
Christ Child House Incident Report dated 8/17/2024 at 2:37
pm. This document outlines the hospital care provided to Youth A
for the bruise on his right forearm and was written by Staff 3.
Youth A informed the doctor that staff (does not identify staff)
would not allow Youth A to go downstairs so Youth A attempted to
go downstairs anyway. Staff (does not identify staff) stopped him
by grabbing Youth A’s wrist and throwing Youth A in the room. It is
documented that Youth A then informed the doctor that staff (does
not identify staff) grabbed Youth A by Youth A’s face with her palm
and pushed Youth A on to his bed. Youth A also informed the
doctor that when staff (does not identify staff) moved her hand she
scratched the top of Youth A’s eyelid. Youth A then said the staff
(does not identify staff) then shut the door and would not let Youth
A out of his room. After staff (does not identify the staff) opened
the door and let Youth A out, Youth A punched the staff (does not
identify the staff) in the stomach and threw something at her. The
doctor informed Youth A staff are there to protect Youth A and
Youth A must listen to their directions. Youth A replied with “ok”
and then told the doctor Youth A apologized to the staff (does not
identify the staff).
Christ Child House Medical Visit Form dated 8/17/2024 for
Youth A and completed by Staff 3. This document outlines the
result of the medical examination on 8/17/24 for the allegations of
abuse by Staff 1. It is documented that the only marks on Youth A
involve a “small bruise” on Youth A’s right forearm. Treatment is
recommended as pain medication as needed.
Staff 1’s personal file was reviewed. Documentation indicates
Staff 1 was hired on 9/10/22 and there are four disciplinary actions
documented in this file, two for attendance, and one for
not taking a youth to their visit and not bringing the youth’s
medication to the visit. The fourth was in regard to this
investigation as noted below.
Christ Child House Employee Behavior and Discipline Report
dated 8/21/24. On 8/20/24, Staff 1 was observed holding Youth
A’s bedroom door shut and this is considered a seclusion. This
seclusion is a violation of Restraint policy CPI techniques. Staff 1
was also found not to have the required walkie on her person.
Staff 1 received a 3-day suspension and last chance agreement.
6

As part of the safety plan, Staff 1 is not permitted to be alone with
any youth until completion of the licensing investigation.
Documentation also indicates Staff 1 is current on required
training and completed the nonviolent Crisis Intervention refresher
on 9/25/23.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as evidence by interviews
with staff, written documentation and video footage shows Staff 1
pushing Youth A into Youth A’s room.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Title prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff secluded youth in room.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/19/2024 and again via video conference on 9/17/24. She
reported Staff 1 was written up for holding the door shut because
it was an inappropriate action which should not have been done.
She reported Staff 1 took responsibility for her actions and was

Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/26/2024. Staff 1

After hearing the cup hit the door, Staff 1 opened the door and

shut the bedroom door again. Staff 1 reported opening the door

Youth A punched Staff 1 in the stomach. Staff 1 then shut the

Video review:
The camera view is from the end of the hallway with Youth A’s
bedroom on the left. Youth A goes into the bedroom followed by
Staff 1. Staff 1 backs out of the room and holds the door shut.
Approximately 4 minutes later Staff 1 opens the door and Youth A
7

comes out of the room and both leave the hallway going
downstairs.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy
dated 1/26/2022. This document outlines staff’s response when a
youth becomes dysregulated, and an intervention is needed.
Prohibited procedures are identified and seclusion is listed as is
documented as “means the involuntary placement of a youth in a
room alone, where youth is prevented from exiting by any means”.
This also includes staff members preventing the youth from exiting
the room.
Christ Child House Employee Behavior and Discipline Report
dated 8/21/24. On 8/20/24, Staff 1 was observed holding Youth
A’s bedroom door shut and this is considered a seclusion. This
seclusion is a violation of Restraint policy CPI techniques. Staff 1
was also found not to have the required walkie on her person.
Staff 1 received a 3-day suspension and last chance agreement.
As part of the safety plan, Staff 1 is not permitted to be alone with
any youth until completion of the licensing investigation.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as evidence by interviews,
written documentation and video footage shows Staff 1 holding
the bedroom door shut on Youth A. Although, Staff 1 engaged in
this inappropriate action by holding Youth A’s door shut, the
facility took swift action and enforced consequences to ensure this
type of action does not occur again.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024SIC0001319 dated 4/8/24, CAP approval dated 7/15/24
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
